com.aseproject.location

Class LocationsHandling

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aseproject.location.LocationsHandling

  • public class LocationsHandling
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines provides the methods for creating the SQLite3 DB that sits locally on the device running the app.
    Author:
    Thanos Irodotou 2012

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String KEY_LATITUDE 
      static java.lang.String KEY_LONGITUDE 
      static java.lang.String KEY_ROWID 
      static java.lang.String KEY_USERNAME 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LocationsHandling(Context c)
      This method provides the Context required for the handler to work.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearDb()
      This method performs a delete query to the sqlite3 database, wiping all its records.
      void close()
      This method closes the connection to the sqlite3 database.
      long createEntry(java.lang.String username, java.lang.Double longitude, java.lang.Double latitude)
      This method receives the user's username and the changes on location values from the local sqlite3 db and creates a new record in the remote MySQL database, transfering the latest values from the GPS receiver.
      long createLocalEntry(java.lang.String username, java.lang.Double longitude, java.lang.Double latitude)
      This method is called whenever the location on the device changes.
      java.lang.String getData()
      This method retrieves the information stored in the local device depended sqlite3 database, by creating a cursor that moves through each and saves the stored values in a String result variable.
      LocationsHandling open()
      This method initialises the connection to the sqlite3 database by getting the Readable Database at each instance.

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public LocationsHandling open()
                       throws SQLException
        This method initialises the connection to the sqlite3 database by getting the Readable Database at each instance.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • close

        public void close()
        This method closes the connection to the sqlite3 database.

      • createEntry

        public long createEntry(java.lang.String username,
               java.lang.Double longitude,
               java.lang.Double latitude)
        This method receives the user's username and the changes on location values from the local sqlite3 db and creates a new record in the remote MySQL database, transfering the latest values from the GPS receiver.
        Parameters:
        username - user's username
        longitude - location's longitude
        latitude - location's latitude
        Returns:
        rowID of the newly created row.

      • createLocalEntry

        public long createLocalEntry(java.lang.String username,
                    java.lang.Double longitude,
                    java.lang.Double latitude)
        This method is called whenever the location on the device changes. It creates a local record kept within the device's sqlite3 db file.
        Parameters:
        username - user's username
        longitude - location's longitude
        latitude - location's latitude
        Returns:
        rowID of the newly created row.

      • getData

        public java.lang.String getData()
        This method retrieves the information stored in the local device depended sqlite3 database, by creating a cursor that moves through each and saves the stored values in a String result variable.
        Returns:
        result.

      • clearDb

        public void clearDb()
        This method performs a delete query to the sqlite3 database, wiping all its records. It was mostly used to wipe clean after testing.
